medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began in the lower abdomen 1 day prior to presentation. It was constant and burning in nature without radiating. On the day of presentation, sharp pain in the RLQ developed while the burning periumbilical pain continued. Patient also reports concomitant chills, nausea, anorexia, and non-bilious non-bloody emesis x2. He has experienced minimal fluid intake and continues to dry heave. Denies fevers, diarrhea, constipation, BRBPR, melena, dysuria, or sick contacts. A similar episode occurred 3 days prior without seeking care.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of inflammatory bowel diseases or colorectal cancer.
